text: [Music]
um I write very fast and I write in
great volume
um uh big and fast is really the way I
write I mostly because I want to get to
through the arc as fast as possible I
don't like insecurity and I don't like
surprises and I don't like not knowing
so I I I really say in writing a short
story I'll try to get to the end as fast
as possible and then I'll spend the next
few months or the next few years editing
um I editing is a big part of my process
probably 75% of it um but the you know
the novel was written about seven months
first draft it was very fast and I
didn't write every day those seven
months either I would have these
Relentless weekends that I would just
write from you know 6:00 a.m. on a
Saturday morning till you know 2: a.m.
on a Monday morning so I I would you
know and then it took another two and a
half years to edit that
novel
um but but fast and big definitely is
something
um that I believe in and is necessary
for me uh I I'd love to be one of those
writers who labors over every sentence
and just goes one sentence at a time
time but that's not really my nature I
believe life is short and let's try to
get it out there and uh just keep going
and not take the whole uh process too
seriously there's so much talk among
writers about the Holy Experience of
writing and and the sacredness of the
art but that that's very intimidating
and that's very um it's a teacher I
don't like to tell my students to think
that way um it's not really going to
send Save the World at the end of the
day if you if you want to help
people go out to soup kitchens go out
you know work one-on-one with the
homeless and uh the truly
disenfranchised in the world but go
there and physically do it um writing a
book is not going to feed anyone at the
end of the day um so I try not to uh you
know put all that posturing into it um
and I also don't believe in writing
every day I think that's what creates
writer block um the feeling that you
must write every day there's then then I
would think eight out of 10 days you're
going to feel like a very bad writer um
and I don't have time for that I want to
write when I when I actually feel good
about what I have to write um and so
that might just be a couple times a week
it might be for like a month nonstop um
but I I've never put that pressure on
myself I've never been one to read the
advice of um other writers or or to play
by those sort of rules the sort of John
Gardener School of you know how to be a
writer and how to think of um the whole
process
um I'm sort of in the you know I'm a
naturally nervous person so I'd like to
cut down on as much anxiety as
possible I I generally work you know the
material that I have the very raw
material is awfully raw I mean it it's
you know sometimes my sentences don't
have period sometimes they're just
fragments sometimes um every word is
misspelled and a jumbled mess and there
might be four adjectives when I only
need one um so I have to really go
sentence by sentence and uh take the the
the Rock and chisel at it and and and
get you know what for some would be the
their first attempt
normal sentence um out of it um so it's
it's pretty brutal but knowing that I
have the whole Arc I have a beginning
middle and an end really becomes
encouraging because then I can look at
the my new ship but if I if I don't have
the macrocosm I can't look at the micro
there's there's no way so I I really
have to actually go back and write
sentences um literally
